channel.title: EasyOnHard - GitHub Pages on EasyOnHard
channel.description: Recent content in EasyOnHard - GitHub Pages on EasyOnHard

item.title: MVGS
item.description:
I don’t really know what I am going to put here. I am only making it to share the CHemistry deck haha.

Chemistry

Cations and Anions Anki Deck This deck is a direct copy of the tables in “Rules of Nomenclature for Binary Compounds”. If you find any errors please make an issue.

item.title: Command Line Utilities
item.description:
I have recently been playing around a bit in the CLI, trying to make it more useful for me. It is one of my favorite things about Linux: the ability to make a super efficient workflow.

The best thing: you can do almost anything through scripting, which is easier and more powerful than Python.

note.zsh

This is a simple ZSH script that simpily makes a .md file, designed for Obsidian, and adds some data.

item.title: Garden Journal
item.description:
About

This journal is a history of my garden, in which I will include illustrations (On the physical version), data, and tips/notes. All data will be relevant to growing zone 6b.

Sources

I will keep good sources here.

Herbal Haven: good for quick facts. Most information about optimal soil and sun exposure comes from here.

Plants

This is where I am keeping all of my data on the plants themselves. Each one will get one paper: one side will be raw information, the second will have use ideas and specific planting dates/tips

item.title: Personal Chatbot
item.description:
My personal AI assistant

I have spent the last two days working on a local chatbot completely written in ZSH. It has been super cool to see it develop from a reformatted Ollama to an actual AI-agent!

Right now it can fetch the weather, date, and run ls… technically. It still has a few kinks to refine, but it can do a good bit!

Capabilities

Right now the bot is in a very early stage of development and can’t do much, but lets see what it can do:

item.title: Myfetch
item.description:
Myfetch

I spent the majority of my day on this project – and it was well worth it!

‚ùØ hyperfine 'target/release/myfetch' 'fastfetch -c ~/.config/fastfetch/config\ \(Copy\).jsonc --logo none' 'neofetch --fast --off'
Benchmark 1: target/release/myfetch
  Time (mean ¬± œÉ):     609.1 ¬µs ¬± 103.2 ¬µs    [User: 491.5 ¬µs, System: 478.5 ¬µs]
  Range (min ‚Ä¶ max):   353.1 ¬µs ‚Ä¶ 1058.0 ¬µs    1981 runs
 
  Warning: Command took less than 5 ms to complete. Note that the results might be inaccurate because hyperfine can not calibrate the shell startup time much more precise than this limit. You can try to use the `-N`/`--shell=none` option to disable the shell completely.
 
Benchmark 2: fastfetch -c ~/.config/fastfetch/config\ \(Copy\).jsonc --logo none
  Time (mean ¬± œÉ):       9.4 ms ¬±   0.3 ms    [User: 1.2 ms, System: 8.0 ms]
  Range (min ‚Ä¶ max):     8.7 ms ‚Ä¶  10.7 ms    270 runs
 
Benchmark 3: neofetch --fast --off
  Time (mean ¬± œÉ):     176.8 ms ¬±   1.5 ms    [User: 105.2 ms, System: 79.2 ms]
  Range (min ‚Ä¶ max):   174.0 ms ‚Ä¶ 180.0 ms    17 runs
 
Summary
  target/release/myfetch ran
   15.51 ¬± 2.68 times faster than fastfetch -c ~/.config/fastfetch/config\ \(Copy\).jsonc --logo none
  290.25 ¬± 49.22 times faster than neofetch --fast --off

(Note: I won’t bring Neofetch back up, and this benchmark is technically rigged because they are both still outputting more info, but that is the Myfetch charm.)

item.title: About
item.description: This is where I am going to put stuff that I think is cool or anything “personal”, like ethics or maybe politics, but I will most likely exclude that because it is a good way to stir up fights. I might write about economics, though. That stuff is fine, maybe.

item.title: Fun Websites
item.description:
This is just a list of cool websites üòÅ

Ana.rchy.gay: Cool, slick website. Very pleasing to the eye!

Polypompholyx: Has a great demonstration of Modular Origami at work.

Last.fm: Not a small site like the first two, but I use it to track my music listening. You should follow me ;)

Birds Aren’t Real: What a fantastic website, kind of like The Church of the FSM.

item.title: Hugo
item.description:
Basic Setup

Hugo is a tool for converting markdown to HTML. It is actually quite straight forward, too! To create a new site you simply run

hugo new site <name>

and then you have a simple site! You can create a page using

hugo new content <path/to/content.md>

For example, you could create the Markdown file “Hugo” in directory content by running

hugo new content Hugo.md

Easy-peasy! WHen creating files within Hugo itself files are automatically given YAML front-matter. This page uses

item.title: Realms 2025
item.description: This year’s Realm has been a ride. It has been most easily divided into two parts: PVP and normal Minecraft. The first part ended on the 4th of June, which I recapped that day. The second part started on June 5th at around 20:00. So far it has been quite competitive in the terms of wealth, but it has been a lot nicer. We no longer need to spend 6 hours a day on it just to make sure you don’t fall behind!

item.title: Esperanto
item.description:
Grammar

![][https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M-TioyqRO9o]

Summary:

  • SVO Structure
    • Objects marked with -n, the accusative case
  • Nouns marked with -o
  • Adjectives marked with -a
  • One article, la
    • La is definite, or ’the'
      • “Mi havas la libro” -> I have the book
    • There is no indefinite article
      • “Mi havas libro” -> I have a book
  • Plurality is marked with -j, similar to the English -s
  • Adverbs marked with -e
    • -e can also mean “In the”
      • “Urbo” -> City
      • “Urbe” -> In the city
  • Conjugation
    • Infinitive -> -i
    • Past -> -is
    • Present -> -as
    • Future -> -os
    • Conditional -> -us
    • Imperative -> -u
  • Adjectives usually before noun

Pronouns
